DND5E.title: Dungeon & Dragons Fifth Edition
DND5E.AbilityUseHint: Configure how you would like to use the {name} {type}.
DND5E.AbilityUseUnavailableHint: There are no uses of this item remaining!
DND5E.AbilityUseChargedHint: This {type} is charged and ready to use!
DND5E.AbilityUseRechargeHint: This {type} is depleted and must be recharged!
DND5E.AbilityUseNormalHint: This {type} has {value} of {max} uses per {per} remaining.
DND5E.AbilityUseConsumableChargeHint: Using this {type} will consume 1 charge of {value} remaining.
DND5E.AbilityUseConsumableQuantityHint: Using this {type} will consume 1 quantity of {quantity} remaining
DND5E.AbilityUseConsumableDestroyHint: Using this {type} will consume its final charge and it will be destroyed.
DND5E.AbilityUseConsumableDestroyResourceHint: Using this {type} will consume the final charge off {name} and destroy it.
DND5E.AbilityConfigurationHint: Configure ability saving throw proficiency, saving throw bonuses, and check bonuses.
DND5E.AbilityCheckGlobalBonusHint: This bonus applies to all ability checks made by this actor.
DND5E.ActionWarningNoItem: The requested item {item} no longer exists on Actor {name}
DND5E.ActionWarningNoToken: You must have one or more controlled Tokens in order to use this option.
DND5E.ActorWarningInvalidItem: {itemType} items cannot be added to a {actorType}.
DND5E.ActorWarningSingleton: Only a single {itemType} can be added to a {actorType}.
DND5E.ActiveEffectOverrideWarning: This value is being modified by an Active Effect and cannot be edited. Disable the effect to edit it.
DND5E.AddEmbeddedItemPromptHint: Do you want to add these items to your character sheet?
DND5E.AdvancementAbilityScoreImprovementHint: Allow the player to increase one or more ability scores or take an optional feat.
DND5E.AdvancementAbilityScoreImprovementCapHin: Maximum number of points a player can assign to a single score.
DND5E.AdvancementAbilityScoreImprovementFeatHi: Drop a feat here to choose one instead of an ability score improvement.
DND5E.AdvancementAbilityScoreImprovementFeatLe: Must be at least level {level} to take this feat.
DND5E.AdvancementAbilityScoreImprovementFeatWa: Only features with the 'feat' type can be selected.
DND5E.AdvancementAbilityScoreImprovementLocked: Scores cannot be modified with a feat selected.
DND5E.AdvancementAbilityScoreImprovementPoints: Number of points that can be assigned to any ability score that doesn't have a fixed improvement set.
DND5E.AdvancementConfigureAllowDropsHint: Should players be able to drop their own choices into this advancement?
DND5E.AdvancementConfigureDropAreaHint: Drop Items here to add them to the pool from which a player can choose.
DND5E.AdvancementDeleteConfirmationMessage: Deleting this item will also delete all advancement choices made for it. These changes will be removed from your character as long as the checkbox below is checked.
DND5E.AdvancementFlowDropAreaHint: Drop an Item here to choose it.
DND5E.AdvancementHitPointsHint: Track the player's hit points for each level in the class.
DND5E.AdvancementHitPointsEmptyError: Hit points must be rolled or the average value must be taken.
DND5E.AdvancementHitPointsInvalidError: Hit points must be a valid whole number.
DND5E.AdvancementItemChoiceHint: Present the player with a choice of items (such as equipment, features, or spells) that they can choose for their character at one or more levels.
DND5E.AdvancementItemChoiceFeatureLevelWarning: Must be at least level {level} to take this feature.
DND5E.AdvancementItemChoiceLevelsHint: Specify how many choices are allowed at each level.
DND5E.AdvancementItemChoiceNoOriginalError: Previously selected choice no longer available for replacement.
DND5E.AdvancementItemChoicePreviouslyChosenWar: This item has already been chosen at a previous level.
DND5E.AdvancementItemChoiceSpellLevelAvailable: Only {level} or lower spells can be chosen for this advancement.
DND5E.AdvancementItemChoiceSpellLevelSpecificW: Only {level} spells can be chosen for this advancement.
DND5E.AdvancementItemChoiceSpellLevelHint: Only allow choices from spells of this level.
DND5E.AdvancementItemChoiceTypeHint: Restrict what Item types can be chosen.
DND5E.AdvancementItemChoiceTypeWarning: Only {type} items can be selected for this choice.
DND5E.AdvancementItemGrantHint: Grant the character items (such as equipment, features, or spells) when they reach a certain level.
DND5E.AdvancementItemGrantDropHint: Drop Items here to add them to the list granted by this advancement.
DND5E.AdvancementItemGrantContainerWarning: Container contents will not be added with containers.
DND5E.AdvancementItemGrantDuplicateWarning: That item already exists on this advancement.
DND5E.AdvancementItemGrantRecursiveWarning: You cannot grant an item in its own advancement.
DND5E.AdvancementItemGrantOptionalHint: If the whole advancement is marked optional, players may opt out of any of the following items, otherwise all non-optional items are granted.
DND5E.AdvancementItemTypeInvalidWarning: {type} items cannot be added with this advancement type.
DND5E.AdvancementLevelDownConfirmationMessage: Leveling this class down will also undo all advancement choices made for it. These changes will be removed from your character as long as the checkbox below is checked.
DND5E.AdvancementManagerCloseMessage: If the advancement process is cancelled, choices made so far will be discarded and no changes will be made to the actor.
DND5E.AdvancementManagerRestartConfirm: Are you sure you wish to undo all choices so far?
DND5E.AdvancementMigrationHint: Select which of the following advancements will be added to {name}.
DND5E.AdvancementScaleValueHint: A single value that changes as a class increases in level that is made available in roll formulas (such as a Monk's martial arts die).
DND5E.AdvancementScaleValueIdentifierHint: This scale value for the current level will be available using @scale.{class}.{identifier} in a formula.
DND5E.AdvancementScaleValueTypeHintCR: Use this for representing creature challenge ratings for features like Wild Shape.
DND5E.AdvancementScaleValueTypeHintDice: Use this for dice values like bardic inspiration, sneak attack, or superiority dice.
DND5E.AdvancementScaleValueTypeHintDistance: Use this for numerical values that represent a distance, such as unarmored movement speed, or aura of protection radius.
DND5E.AdvancementScaleValueTypeHintNumber: Use this for purely numerical values like rage damage bonus or number of uses per day.
DND5E.AdvancementScaleValueTypeHintString: Use this if you are unsure of the type of the scale values, or if the type does not matter.
DND5E.AdvancementTraitHint: Grant a character certain traits or give them an option to select traits (such as proficiencies, skills, languages).
DND5E.AdvancementTraitAllowReplacementsHint: If a trait is already set on the actor, allow the player to choose from any other trait as a replacement.
DND5E.AdvancementTraitChoicesHint: The following traits will be presented as a choice to the player.
DND5E.AdvancementTraitGrantsHint: The following traits will be granted to the character as long as they don't already possess that trait.
DND5E.AdvancementTraitModeExpertiseHint: Gain expertise in a trait in which you already have proficiency.
DND5E.AdvancementTraitModeForceHint: Gain expertise in a trait regardless of your previous proficiency level.
DND5E.AdvancementTraitModeUpgradeHint: Gain proficiency in a trait unless you already have it, otherwise gain expertise.
DND5E.ArmorConfigHint: Fill in the above box to override automatically calculated armor class.

Award.Title: Distribute Award
Award.NoPrimaryParty: No primary party set, displaying characters assigned to players instead.
Award.NotGMError: The /award command is only available to GMs.
Award.UnrecognizedWarning: Unable to parse {commands}. The /award command should be used with XP & currencies values such as '/award 10gp 50xp'.

DND5E.BonusesHint: Define global bonuses as formulas which are added to certain rolls. For example: 1d4 + 2
DND5E.BonusesInstructions: Configure character bonuses which are added to the appropriate dice roll

Controls.Hint: Enable various hints throughout the UI for certain mouse and keyboard controls.
Controls.Name: Enable Control Hints

DND5E.ClassIdentifierHint: This class's data will be accessible using @classes.{identifier} in roll formulas.
DND5E.ClassMakeOriginalHint: First class taken by character used to determine certain class traits when multiclassing.
DND5E.ContainerDeleteMessage: This container will be permanently deleted and cannot be recovered and the {count} items contained within will be moved out.
DND5E.ContainerDeleteContents: Also delete all items within the container.
DND5E.ContainerMaxDepth: Containers cannot be nested more than {depth} levels deep.
DND5E.ConcentrationBreakWarning: Breaking concentration on an effect that is active on other creatures requires an active GM to be present.
DND5E.ConcentratingOn: You are maintaining concentration on the effects of the '{name}' {type}.
DND5E.ConcentratingEndChoice: You are concentrating on effects from more than one source. Pick which effect to end.
DND5E.ConcentratingMissingItem: The effect that is concentrated on and to be replaced does not exist.
DND5E.ConcentratingLimited: You are not able to begin concentrating on an additional effect.
DND5E.ConcentratingWarnLimit: You cannot maintain concentration on more effects!
DND5E.ConcentratingWarnLimitOptional: You may end concentration on one of your maintained effects to use this item.
DND5E.ConcentratingWarnLimitZero: You are not able to maintain concentration on any effects!
DND5E.ConcentrationConfigurationHint: Configure concentration modifiers and bonuses which apply to this creature.
DND5E.ConsumeWarningNoResource: {name} is designated to consume {type} but no resource is specified!
DND5E.ConsumeWarningNoSource: The designated {type} source that {name} consumes no longer exists!
DND5E.ConsumeWarningNoQuantity: {name} has run out of its designated {type}!
DND5E.ConsumeWarningZeroAttribute: {name} has run out of its designated attribute resource pool!
DND5E.ConsumeScalingTooltip: If checked, consuming additional resources will increase the level the spell is cast at.
DND5E.ConsumableLastChargeWarn: This is the last charge of this unit and consuming it will also reduce the item's quantity by 1

Convert.Label: Convert
Convert.Hint: Convert all carried currency to the highest possible denomination to reduce the amount of coinage carried by the character. Be wary, this action cannot be undone.

DamageModification.Label: Damage Modification
DamageModification.Hint: Formulas for amounts that will be added to typed damage applied to this actor. Negative values will reduce the damage taken.
DamageModification.BypassHint: These weapon properties will bypass damage modification for physical damage.

DND5E.DamagePhysicalBypassHint: These weapon properties will bypass damage resistance for physical damage.
DND5E.DeathSaveCriticalSuccess: {name} critically succeeded on a death saving throw and has regained 1 Hit Point!
DND5E.DeathSaveSuccess: {name} has survived with 3 death save successes and is now stable!
DND5E.DeathSaveFailure: {name} has died with 3 death save failures!
DND5E.DeathSaveUnnecessary: You do not need to roll death saves because you have a positive number of hit points or have already reached 3 successes or failures.
DND5E.DocumentUseWarn: You lack permission to use an item on this document.
DND5E.DocumentViewWarn: You lack permission to view this document.
DND5E.EffectApplyWarningConcentration: Applying an effect that is being concentrated on by another character requires GM permissions.
DND5E.EffectApplyWarningOwnership: Effects cannot be applied to tokens you are not the owner of.

Category.Empty: No enchantments have been created, use the button above to create one.

Enchantment.DropArea: Place item here to enchant it…

classIdentifier.hint: Identifier used to determine whether the character level or a specific class level should be used for enchantment level limits.

max.label: Item Limit
max.hint: Formula for the maximum number of enchantments of this type that can be active at a time.

period.label: Replacement Period
period.hint: How frequently the enchantments of this type can be re-bound to different items.

restrictions.label: Restrictions
restrictions.hint: Restrictions on the type of item to which this enchantment can be applied.

allowMagical.label: Allow Magical
allowMagical.hint: Allow items that are already magical to be enchanted.

type.label: Item Type
type.hint: Type of item to which this enchantment can be applied.

Enchantment.Label: Enchantment

Level.Hint: Range of levels required to use this enchantment.

Effect.Label: Additional Effects
Effect.Hint: These additional effects will be added to the enchanted item when this enchantment is added, and removed when the enchantment is removed.

Item.Label: Additional Items
Item.Hint: These additional items will be added to the creature when one of its items is enchanted, and will be removed if the enchantment is ever removed.

Warning.ConcentrationEnded: Cannot apply this enchantment because concentration has ended.
Warning.NoMagicalItems: Items that are already magical cannot be enchanted.
Warning.NotOnActor: Enchantments can only be added to items, not directly to actors.
Warning.Override: This value is being modified by an Enchantment and cannot be edited. Disable the enchantment in the effects tab to edit it.
Warning.WrongType: {incorrectType} items cannot be enchanted by this enchantment, only {allowedType} items are allowed.

DND5E.EffectUnavailableInfo: Source item must be equipped or attuned to activate these
DND5E.FilterNoSpells: No spells found for this set of filters.
DND5E.NoSpellLevels: This character has no spellcaster levels, but you may add spells manually.
DND5E.FlagsInstructions: Configure character features and traits which fine-tune behaviors of the DnD5e system.
DND5E.FlagsDiamondSoulHint: Gain proficiency to all saving throws.
DND5E.FlagsElvenAccuracyHint: Roll an extra d20 with advantage to Dex, Int, Wis, or Cha.
DND5E.FlagsHalflingLuckyHint: Reroll ones when rolling d20 checks.
DND5E.FlagsInitiativeAdvHint: Provided by feats or magical items.
DND5E.FlagsJOATHint: Half-Proficiency to Ability Checks in which you are not already Proficient.
DND5E.FlagsObservantHint: Provides a +5 to passive Perception and Investigation.
DND5E.FlagsRemarkableAthleteHint: Half-Proficiency (rounded-up) to physical Ability Checks and Initiative.
DND5E.FlagsWeaponCritThresholdHint: An expanded critical hit threshold for weapon attacks.
DND5E.FlagsSpellCritThresholdHint: An expanded critical hit threshold for spell attacks.
DND5E.FlagsMeleeCriticalDiceHint: A number of additional damage dice added to melee weapon critical hits.
DND5E.FormulaMissingReferenceWarn: The {property} formula within {name} has references to missing data: {references}
DND5E.HPFormulaError: The provided hit point formula could not be evaluated.

HitDiceAutoSpend.Label: Auto Spend HD
HitDiceAutoSpend.Hint: Automatically spend hit dice until they run out or health is full.

DND5E.HitDiceConfigHint: Adjust remaining hit dice levels for each class.
DND5E.HitDiceWarn: {name} has no available {formula} Hit Dice remaining!
DND5E.HitDiceNPCWarn: {name} has no available Hit Dice remaining!
DND5E.IdentifierError: Identifier can only contain letters (a-z), numbers (0-9), dashes (-), and underscores (_).
DND5E.InitiativeConfigHint: Configure initiative modifiers and bonuses which apply to this Actor.
DND5E.ItemAttackFlatHint: If checked, don't add proficiency, ability modifier, or any other bonuses to attack roll except what is included here.
DND5E.ItemDestroyEmptyTooltip: If this item has limited uses, it will be destroyed when none are left.
DND5E.ItemRecoveryFormulaWarning: Unable to recover charges for {name}. Invalid recovery formula '{formula}'.
DND5E.LimitedUsesPromptTooltip: If unchecked, the prompt to consume an available use will be suppressed.
DND5E.LongRestHint: Take a long rest? On a long rest you will recover hit points, half your maximum hit dice, class resources, limited use item charges, and spell slots.
DND5E.LongRestHintGroup: Take a long rest? On a long rest group members will recover hit points, half of their maximum hit dice, class resources, limited use item charges, and spell slots.
DND5E.LongRestResult: {name} takes a long rest and recovers {health} Hit Points and {dice} Hit Dice.
DND5E.LongRestResultHitDice: {name} takes a long rest and recovers {dice} Hit Dice.
DND5E.LongRestResultHitPoints: {name} takes a long rest and recovers {health} Hit Points.
DND5E.MaxCharacterLevelExceededWarn: Character cannot be advanced past level {max}.
DND5E.MaxClassLevelExceededWarn: Class cannot be advanced past level {max}.
DND5E.MaxClassLevelMinimumWarn: Class must have at least one level.
DND5E.ModuleArtConfigH: Configure which module-provided art should be used.
DND5E.ModuleArtPriorityHint: Use the arrows to adjust the priority of the art sources. When a single Actor has art provided from multiple sources, the one with the highest priority will be used.
DND5E.Name: Character Name
DND5E.PolymorphKeepAE: Keep all effects (overrides other effect retention options).
DND5E.PolymorphKeepBackgroundAE: Keep effects that originate from your background?
DND5E.PolymorphKeepClass: Keep proficiency bonus (leaves class items in sheet)
DND5E.PolymorphKeepClassAE: Keep effects that originate from your class or subclass?
DND5E.PolymorphKeepEquipmentAE: Keep effects that originate from your equipment?
DND5E.PolymorphKeepFeatureAE: Keep effects that originate from your features?
DND5E.PolymorphKeepMental: Keep mental ability scores (Int, Wis, Cha)
DND5E.PolymorphKeepOriginAE: Keep effects that originate from this actor (i.e. effects not attached to features, items, spells)
DND5E.PolymorphKeepOtherOriginAE: Keep effects that originate from a different actor?
DND5E.PolymorphKeepPhysical: Keep physical ability scores (Str, Dex, Con)
DND5E.PolymorphKeepSelf: Keep self (just change image and size i.e. for spells like Disguise Self)
DND5E.PolymorphKeepSpellAE: Keep effects that originate from your spells?
DND5E.PolymorphMergeSaves: Merge saving throw proficiencies (take the highest)
DND5E.PolymorphRevertNoOriginalActorWarn: No original actor was found with reference '{reference}'
DND5E.PolymorphRevertWarn: You do not have permission to revert this Actor's polymorphed state.
DND5E.PolymorphWarn: You are not allowed to polymorph this actor!

level.label: Required Level
level.hint: Character or class level required to select this feature when levelling up.

DND5E.MovementConfigHint: Configure movement speed and special movement attributes.
DND5E.NewDayHint: Recover limited use abilities which recharge "per day"?
DND5E.SaveGlobalBonusHint: This bonus applies to all saving throws made by this actor.

Explanation.Label: Explanation
Explanation.Hint: Amount of the rules on using spell scrolls to include in the created scroll.

DND5E.SensesConfigHint: Configure any special sensory perception abilities that this actor possesses.
DND5E.ShortRestHint: Take a short rest? On a short rest you may spend remaining Hit Dice and recover item uses.
DND5E.ShortRestHintGroup: Take a short rest? On a short rest group members can spend Hit Dice and will recover item uses.
DND5E.ShortRestResult: {name} takes a short rest spending {dice} Hit Dice to recover {health} Hit Points.
DND5E.SkillGlobalBonusCheckHint: This bonus applies to all skill checks made by this actor.
DND5E.SpellCastNoSlots: You have no available {level} spell slots with which to cast {name}
DND5E.SpellCastNoSlotsLeft: You have no available spell slots with which to cast {name}!

Warning.Depth: Only three levels of depth allowed in starting equipment.
Warning.ItemTypeInvalid: {type} items cannot be added to starting equipment.

Wealth.Label: Starting Wealth
Wealth.Hint: Formula in GP that can be used in place of starting equipment.

DND5E.SubclassIdentifierHint: This identifier should match the identifier on the parent class to ensure they are properly linked.
DND5E.SubclassAssignmentError: {class} already has a subclass. Remove the existing '{subclass}' subclass before adding a new one.
DND5E.SubclassDuplicateError: A subclass with the identifier {identifier} already exists on this actor.
DND5E.SubclassMismatchWarn: {name} subclass has no matching class with identifier '{class}'.

ArmorClass.Label: Bonus Armor Class
ArmorClass.Hint: Bonus to the Armor Class set on the summoned creature added to what is specified in their statblock.

Attack.Label: Bonus Attack Damage
Attack.Hint: Additional damage done by the creature's attacks.

Healing.Label: Bonus Healing
Healing.Hint: Additional healing provided by healing abilities.

HitDice.Label: Bonus Hit Dice
HitDice.Hint: Additional hit dice added to the creature on top of what is derived from the HP formula in their statblock. Can only be used when summoning NPC actors.

HitPoints.Label: Bonus Hit Points
HitPoints.Hint: Additional hit points added to the creature on top of what is specified in their statblock.

Saves.Label: Bonus Save Damage
Saves.Hint: Additional damage done by the creature's abilities that require saving throws.

CreatureChanges.Label: Creature Changes
CreatureChanges.Hint: Changes that will be made to the creature being summoned. Any @ references used in the following formulas will be based on the summoner's stats. Summoned creature's stats can be referenced using @summon (e.g. @summon.attributes.hd.max to reference the creature's hit dice count).

CreatureSizes.Label: Creature Sizes
CreatureSizes.Hint: Summoned creature and token will be changed to this size. If more than one size is selected, then the player will be able to choose from these sizes when summoning.

CreatureTypes.Label: Creature Types
CreatureTypes.Hint: Summoned creature will be changed to this type. If more than one type is selected, then the player will be able to choose from these types when summoning.

ItemChanges.Label: Item Changes
ItemChanges.Hint: Changes made to items on the summoned creature.

Level.Hint: Range of levels required to use this profile.
Level.IdentifierHint: Identifier used to determine whether the character level or a specific class level should be used for profile level limits.

Attacks.Label: Match Attacks
Attacks.Hint: Modify to hit values on the summoned creature's attacks to match that of the summoner.

Proficiency.Label: Match Proficiency
Proficiency.Hint: Modify the summoned creature's proficiency to match that of the summoner.

Saves.Label: Match Saves
Saves.Hint: Modify to saving throw DCs on the summoned creature's abilities to match that of the summoner.

Profile.Label: Summons Profile
Profile.Empty: Click above to add a profile or drop an creature to summon here.

Prompt.Label: Summon Prompt
Prompt.Hint: Disable the summoning prompt when item is used. Players will still be able to summon from the chat card.

Warning.CreateActor: You must have 'Create New Actors' permission in order to summon directly from a compendium.
Warning.NoActor: Actor cannot be found with UUID '{uuid}' to summon.
Warning.NoOwnership: You must have ownership of '{actor}' in order to summon it.
Warning.Wildcard: You must have 'Use File Browser' permissions to summon creatures with wildcard artwork.

DND5E.TemplatePromptTooltip: If unchecked, the prompt for placing a Measured Template will be suppressed.

Subject.Label: Subject Path
Subject.Hint: Explicitly specify a path for the artwork placed over the dynamic token ring. If not provided, the subject image will be set to the normal token artwork.

Unidentified.Notice: You must identify this item to learn its details.
Unidentified.Title: Unidentified

DND5E.VehicleActionsHint: Actions taken with full crew complement
DND5E.WarnBadACFormula: The provided AC formula could not be evaluated.
DND5E.WarnCantAddMultipleAdvancements: It is not currently possible to add multiple items with advancements to an actor at the same time. Please add them individually.
DND5E.WarnMultipleArmor: More than one suit of armor equipped, AC calculation may be incorrect.
DND5E.WarnMultipleShields: More than one shield equipped, AC calculation may be incorrect.
DND5E.description: A system for playing the fifth edition of the worlds most popular roleplaying game in the Foundry Virtual Tabletop environment.

Inline.NoActorWarning: No selected or assigned actor could be found to execute this roll.

Warning.NoActor: No selected or assigned actor could be found to execute this roll.
Warning.NoItemOnActor: {actor} does not have an Item with name {item}.

Class.AdditionalEquipmentHint: Additional descriptive text displayed beneath the starting equipment section.
Class.AdditionalHitPointsHint: Additional descriptive text displayed beneath the auto-generated hit points section.
Class.AdditionalTraitsHint: Additional descriptive text displayed beneath list of proficiencies granted by this class.
Class.DescriptionHint: Primary description of the class that will appear first.
Class.EquipmentDescription: You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:
Class.FeaturesDescription: As a {lowercaseName}, you gain the following class features, which are summarized in the {name} table.
Class.HitPointsLevel1: Hit Points at 1st Level: {max} + your Constitution modifier
Class.HitPointsLevelX: Hit Points at Higher Levels: {dice} (or {average}) + your Constitution modifier per {class} level after 1st
Class.NoValidClass: No valid class selected, press the edit button to add a class.
Class.OptionalFeaturesDescription: The following section contains options {class} features. These features are not granted automatically, and you can choose one, some, or all of them at your DM's discretion.
Class.SubclassDescriptionHint: Introduction that will be displayed before this class's subclasses.

SpellList.DropHint: Drop spells or folders of spells here to add to the list

Grouping.Label: Grouping Mode
Grouping.Hint: Controls how the spells will be grouped by default in the spell list.

SpellList.IdentifierHint: Identifier should match that defined on the associated document, if applicable. For example, when creating a spell list for the Wizard class, the identifier should be 'wizard'.

Subclass.DescriptionHint: Description of the subclass that will appear before any listed features.
Subclass.NoValidSubclass: No valid subclass selected, press the edit button to add a subclass.

MACRO.5eMissingTargetWarn: Your controlled actor '{actor}' does not have an {type} with name '{name}'.
MACRO.5eMultipleTargetsWarn: Your controlled actor '{actor}' has more than one {type} with name '{name}'. The first match will be chosen.
MACRO.5eNoActorSelected: No selected or assigned actor could be found to target with macro.
MACRO.5eUnownedWarn: You can only create macro buttons for owned Items

MIGRATION.5eBegin: Applying D&D 5e System Migration for version {version}. Please be patient and do not close your game or shut down your server.
MIGRATION.5eComplete: D&D 5e System Migration to version {version} completed!
MIGRATION.5eVersionTooOldWarning: Your D&D 5e system data is from too old a Foundry version and cannot be reliably migrated to the latest version. The process will be attempted, but errors may occur.

SETTINGS.5eAllowPolymorphingL: Allow players to polymorph their own actors.
SETTINGS.5eAutoCollapseCardL: Automatically collapse Item Card descriptions in the Chat Log
SETTINGS.5eAutoSpellTemplateL: When a spell is cast, defaults to begin the process to create the corresponding Measured Template if any (requires TRUSTED or higher player role)

5eChallengeVisibility.Name: Challenge Visibility
5eChallengeVisibility.Hint: Control what roll DCs are visible to the players and whether successes/failures are highlighted.

SETTINGS.5eCriticalMaxDiceL: Make critical hits more deadly by maximizing the values of base damage dice.
SETTINGS.5eCriticalModifiersL: Make critical hits more deadly by multiplying non-dice modifiers in addition to rolled dice.
SETTINGS.5eCurWtL: Carried currency affects character encumbrance following the rules on PHB pg. 143.
SETTINGS.5eDiagL: Configure which diagonal movement rule should be used for games within this system.

5eEncumbrance.Hint: Enable automatic tracking of encumbrance and the application of status effects for characters carrying too much.
5eEncumbrance.Name: Encumbrance Tracking

SETTINGS.5eFeatsL: Allow players to choose a feat rather than taking an ability score improvement during class advancement.
SETTINGS.5eHonorL: Enable the use of the optional Honor ability score. Requires the world to be reloaded.
SETTINGS.5eInitTBL: Append the raw Dexterity ability score to break ties in Initiative.
SETTINGS.5eMetricL: Replaces all reference to lbs with kgs and updates the encumbrance calculations to use metric weight units.
SETTINGS.5eNoAdvancementsL: Do not prompt for level-up or character creation choices.
SETTINGS.5eNoConcentrationL: Disable the system's automated tracking of concentration.
SETTINGS.5eNoExpL: Remove experience bars from character sheets.
SETTINGS.5eProfL: Configure proficiency modifier to use a fixed bonus or a dice roll. Reloading the world is required for this change to take effect.
SETTINGS.5eRestL: Configure which rest variant should be used for games within this system.
SETTINGS.5eGridAlignedSquareTemplatesL: When square templates are created as the result of casting a spell or using an item, they will be locked to the grid alignment and unable to be rotated.
SETTINGS.5eSanityL: Enable the use of the optional Sanity ability score. Requires the world to be reloaded.

5eTokenRings.Name: Disable Dynamic Token Rings
5eTokenRings.Hint: Disabling the token ring animations can improve performance.

ALLOWSUMMONING.Name: Allow Summoning
ALLOWSUMMONING.Hint: Allow players to use summoning abilities to summon actors. Players must also have the Create Token core permission for this to work.

COLLAPSETRAYS.Name: Collapse Trays in Chat
COLLAPSETRAYS.Hint: Automatically collapse damage, hit, and effect trays that appear in chat cards.

THEME.Name: Theme
THEME.Hint: Theme that will apply to the UI and all sheets by default. Automatic will be determined by your browser or operating system settings.
